title: U.S. Says Myanmar Military Committed Genocide Against Rohingya
sub_head: Biden administration concludes army’s campaign of mass killings and rape had clear intent to destroy minority community
body:
The Biden administration has concluded that the Myanmar military’s violence against the Rohingya minority amounts to genocide, a rare designation that comes around five years after the military’s campaign of mass killings, rape and arson attacks drove hundreds of thousands of Rohingya to flee their homeland.
Secretary of State Antony Blinken said attacks against the Rohingya in 2016 and 2017 were widespread and systematic and that there was a clear intent to destroy the Rohingya community. The finding marks the eighth time since the Holocaust that the U.S. has determined that genocide was committed.
